page.title: 04WILDLIFE (1)
page.content:
The{fox}and the{badger}are the largest wild animals found. {Weasels}and {stoats}abound, and there is no shortage of{hares, rabbits, hedgehogs or{grey squirrels,}with some{ferrel {cats, "escaped" mink, voles}and{moles. The mammals tend to be shy and not easily seen.
The{pipestrelle bat}is commonly seen; {frogs}survive and{toads}seem plentiful.
No large area of woodland survives to carry a{deer herd, but the occasional {muntjac}will stray in from nearby areas.
{Foxhunting, fishing}and{rabbiting}all have their devotees and an equal number of antagonists.
